text: and a quick mention of a story that's
just breaking were being told that the
deputy director of the FBI in the USA
has stepped down from his current role
effective today now this is this is
citing sources familiar with the matter
they say deputy director McCabe that is
Andrew McCabe has stepped down from the
current role effective on Monday now we
don't have lots of details all I will
say is that of course there's been a
huge amount of tension between the White
House and Donald Trump's administration
and the FBI because of the investigation
into alleged Russia links and of course
we also remember that just before
Christmas I think it was mr. Trump was
on social media on Twitter directly
attacking mr. mchabe and accusing him of
having mishandled the investigation into
Hillary Clinton's email issues so there
has been a lot of bad blood if you like
between mr. Trump and mr. mchabe and
lots of pressure but I think it's fair
to say that this has caused a bit of a
surprise in the past 10 or 12 minutes or
so the announcement that Andrew McCabe
the FBI's Deputy Director such a senior
figure in US public life he has stepped
down from his current role effective
today
